poem:
**Morning Headlines**

Guy Pearce dons the mantle of Murdoch,  
as Danny Boyle directs the echoes  
of ink-stained ambitions.  
Larry Lamb waits in the wings,  
the Sun poised to rise or set again.  
A world spins on a reel, frames unfurl,  
each scene a snapshot of empire dreams,  
played out under electric stars.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Guy Pearce set to play Rupert Murdoch in Danny Boyle-directed drama Danny Boyle is set to direct an adaptation of award-winning play Ink, based on the rise of the Rupert Murdoch empire. According to Deadline, Guy Pearce is in talks to take on the lead role with Jack O’Connell also in negotiations to star as Larry Lamb, who Murdoch hired to run the Sun in the late 1960s. The film will be written by original". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Guy Pearce set to play Rupert Murdoch in Danny Boyle-directed drama Danny Boyle is set to direct an adaptation of award-winning play Ink, based on the rise of the Rupert Murdoch empire. According to Deadline, Guy Pearce is in talks to take on the lead role with Jack O’Connell also in negotiations to star as Larry Lamb, who Murdoch hired to run the Sun in the late 1960s. The film will be written by original
